name: The Maxwell Hotel Seattle

reviews.text: The Maxwell Hotel is very nice. Rooms have modern decor and comfortable furnishings. Very good pod coffee makers in the rooms. Nice bar / restaurant in the lobby. The service was extremely friendly and efficient, as good as I've had anywhere.
reviews.title: Very nice and reasonably priced

reviews.text: I stayed here with friends for one night and I wish I could have stayed longer! Upon arrival, we were given complimentary parking in the garage that is directly under the hotel. The front desk handled check-in quickly and were helpful in helping plan out a walking tour of the area. The room was comfortable and had a nice retro theme. There were nice touches like coffee and cupcakes in the lobby. The location suited us well and after we parked, we were able to walk to local shops, sites, and bars and restaurants -- no extra driving needed. For the price (slightly better than other well-reviewed properties in the area), I was extremely pleased.
reviews.title: An excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are clean and well-appointed. Large bathroom with plenty of counter space and walk-in shower. Our room was wonderfully quiet - whether that was due to our mid-December stay or not I don't know. It was very easy to get to Seattle Center (Space Needle, Experience Music, etc) and we took advantage of the hotel's free shuttle to Pike Market (also picked up the monorail on the way back). We really liked the ability to get around via car without the hassle of downtown traffic. The Queen Anne neighborhood has lots of neat little restaurants and the hotel staff were spot-on with recommendations and directions. Loved the free parking but be aware the spaces are very tight. Only complaint was the line of soap/shampoo/lotion used in the rooms was overly perfume-y.
reviews.title: Great for exploring Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this was a great hotel, and so reasonably priced. Everything was very clean, and well appointed. The faux hardwood floors are so much better than carpet. My only complaint is rather odd, they have the noisiest sheets! I've never experienced sheets that made noise when you turn over, my husband thought the same. Otherwise, the bed was very comfy. The Rock restaurant in the lobby has excellent pizza. The hotel is nicely located in lower Queen Anne. The free parking in their secure garage was a real plus. It was easy to get where we wanted to go in the car, and by cab (just a few minutes to get downtown via cab if you didn't want to worry about parking downtown). Efficient staff.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Maxwell for four nights a few days before Christmas. This two year old hotel is only two blocks from the Space needle. The rooms were very clean and good size. The bathroom and shower were extra large, and we had an exceptional view of the Space Needle from our window. The only drawback was a lack of a bar or restaurant in the hotel for those late night dinners or nightcaps and breakfast. A newly built upscale pizza establishment on the corner and connected to the hotel was to open in January 1, 2012. There is also a great Irish Pub across the street no more than 50 yards out the front door of the hotel. We decided to get tickets for the Nutcracker Ballet at McGraw Hall which was only one block out the hotels front door.
reviews.title: Great Place - Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are in Seattle for a long weekend and wanted to stay all over the area. What a great hotel to start the weekend! Our room is spacious, clean, chic and very comfortable! I love the view of the Space Needle!
reviews.title: Love this Hotel!

reviews.text: We walked about 5 miles last night, getting the lay of the land. Jacob at the front desk was so helpful, giving us great recommendations for things to do, places to eat, etc. The hotel isn't super close to the bay or the Market, but nonetheless, still a great location.
reviews.title: Absolutely return next time in Seattle!!

reviews.text: We loved the cupcakes, free parking, free wifi and all the goodies in the room, including the bath amenities! I highly recommend this hotel and would totally stay here again!
reviews.title: The Maxwell Hotel Seattle is relax and laid back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Appreciate my Maxwell experience, welcoming for my late night arrival check-in and allowed a later check-out. Enjoyed the relaxing room - bed & bathroom. Wonderful customer service from Ryan & Lynn to make sure my stay was fabulous & no problems
reviews.title: None Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel's pineapple logo is really cute! It immediately catch my attention. The hotel's line is... "Pineapple Hospitality" and my family enjoyed it! We arrived at 5pm and they welcome us with yummy cupcakes and Starbucks coffee! The best part, free parking! Parking in Seattle is expensive and that is a plus points to Maxwell. They have excellent linens and I love their toiletries. Maxwell Hotel is just 10 - 15 minutes walk to Space Needle and some Museums like EMP, Science Center & Glass Garden and there are charming yummy restaurants around the area. It is very homey at Maxwell.
reviews.title: When traveling to Seattle, the Maxwell is a MUST!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located very close to the Space Needle- a little bit farther to downtown locations like Pike Place market and Safeco. The hotel is new and has a very nice design with wood floors and nice amenities. The hotel is a little too kid and dog-friendly for me but that might be a plus for you.
reviews.title: Some Pros/some Cons

reviews.text: There are several restaurants within a few blocks- most are Thai, Pho, or pub varieties. One downside is that there is no real restaurant in the hotel for breakfast or dinner. They do have a pizza wood-fired place.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: After camping through Canada the Maxwell was beyond amazing! First off, it was pet friendly!!! What a concept -- a nice, clean pet friendly hotel! The service was great! Our truck was much taller than the height requirement for the garage on site and instead of making us park on the street they allowed us to park in the check-in parking!! The rooms were beautiful and absolutely spotless. The Rock restaurant in the hotel was great -- good food and local beers! The location could not be beat!!! A few blocks from the Space Needle and very easy to get to from I-5. I have already recommended the Maxell to many people who may be coming through Seattle!
reviews.title: Very Comfortable!

reviews.text: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed at The Maxwell to explore Seattle for a few days. I must say that this is probably the cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed in, and the beds and pillows are unbelievably comfortable! All the staff are friendly, professional and helpful. I chose this location because it is so close to the Seattle Center--a very short walk. And the hotel provides a free shuttle to Pikes Place Market and the Waterfront area--we used the service two days and the driver was prompt! There is no complimentary breakfast, but The Maxwell is a very short walking distance to two markets where you can stock up the minifridge, plus there is a limited cafe in the hotel where you can get a quick bite in the morning. There's a pizza restaurant attached to the hotel--the service is great, but I suggest you stick to their pizza menu. The pizza is delicious, with great options--other menu items are so-so. The neighborhood is quiet, and I found the hotel fairly quiet as well. I must give kudos to the housekeeping staff--the rooms were cleaned and restocked every day before we returned in the evening. Ask the front desk about a discounted ride to the airport. Very happy with our stay--thank you!!
reviews.title: A for Service, Location and Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Maxwell House hotel. The manager, front desk agents, especially Leticia, as well as the housekeeping staff and shuttle driver were all extremely friendly, genuinely interested in helping make our trip memorable. Our room was very nice and cleaned thoroughly each day. You can't beat the location near Seattle Center and the quaint Queen Anne district. I left an item in the room and spoke to Antonio in Housekeeping who found the item and is mailing it to me. Thank you. We would definitely go back and recommend Maxwell House.
reviews.title: This place is great!

reviews.text: My family and I had an excellent stay at the Maxwell in mid-June 2013. Wide assortment of room types. We stayed in a Prima Donna room, well appointed, excellent value, plenty of space (two very comfortable kings for my wife and me plus my mother and daughter, plus a sleeper sofa with a memory foam mattress that my teenaged son, who while traveling with us usually has to sleep on uncomfortable sleeper sofas, said was very comfortable and definitely the most comfortable sleeper sofa he had ever experienced). The room's corner position gave us partial view (upper portion) of the Space Needle, otherwise unremarkable view out over Roy St., but the proximity (one block!) of the hotel to the Seattle Center complex (Space Needle, Pacific Science Museum, EMP Museum, Monorail (to Westlake Mall and Pike's Market), etc.) and the free parking that every other hotel wanted to charge $20+ a day for, made the hotel a definite Win. Additionally, the lobby was large and well appointed, virtually everything in the hotel was well maintained (see below for the only two exceptions), *all* staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the in-hotel restaurant was excellent (and apparently quite locally popular). The free shuttle service to nearby sites and the free-to-use bicycles were nice amenities, too. My son very much liked the food he got at the tiny breakfast/coffee shop in the lobby, too. The only "problems" were slow WiFi and spotty satellite TV service on some channels, but we weren't in the room all that much and were too tired at the end of each day's touring for these issues to have soured our experience. All in all, we found the Maxwell to be a very nice, well-located, great-value, quite enjoyable departure from the usual chain hotels; I would definitely consider staying there again with family, though if I were on business (and on an expense account), I might look for a more upscale chain hotel with better Internet service.
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.text: I chose the Maxwell Hotel originally as I got a great deal through Expedia and it had some excellent reviews. Having stayed here I can add to those great reviews by recommending the hotel to any visitors to Seattle.
reviews.title: Great base for Seattle visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a clean, modern hotel with friendly staff and our room was large with an excellent bathroom and very little noticeable noise. Location-wise, it's a little away from the city centre but you can easily access the city by bus or a short walk to the monorail station at the Space Needle. There is a small kiosk where you can buy snacks but better still, it is a short walk to a couple of great breakfast spots, both Citizen and Toulouse Petit Kitchen.
reviews.title: Sleek and Stylish

reviews.text: All in all a great stay in Seattle which was enhanced by the marvellous lodging at The Maxwell.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Great location
reviews.text: The Maxwell is a great looking hotel with friendly staff, but there were many misses. Our king room was nicely appointed and suitably spacious--very modern. However, while the shower was spacious, there was no bathtub. Nor was there a door on the shower, which wasn't a problem for me, but my wife likes it steamy, and instead felt cold drafts. There was also no soap provided, just dispensers of shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner in the shower. The sink area had soap and hand lotion dispensers. Water pressure in the shower was very weak. Wifi worked well, but was slow. While their website noted there was breakfast available, it was really just a kiosk, with vastly overpriced items. Staff was very friendly, but not very well informed. Accurate answers to questions depended on whom you asked. While I was standing around waiting for a computer to free up to print boarding passes, a staff member asked if I needed help. When I told her I was just waiting for a computer to free up so I could print boarding passes, she directed me downstairs where there was another computer. Great, except there was no printer there and I had to come back up where meanwhile someone had grabbed the computer I was waiting for, and so I had to wait some more. When I inquired about a taxi to the airport, I got good infomation on how long it would take for one to show up and how long the ride would be. When I asked another staff member later the same question, he told me it would be better to rent a car and driver, which saved us about $15, so good for him, but not for the rest of the staff. When you print your receipt for your booking, it will not indicate the taxes, which were substantial. And finally, and this is my fault, it appears that the hotel overlooks the square where the space needle is located, but it does not, because there is a parking garage blocking that view. I should have taken a look on Google Earth before hand. On a return trip to Seattle, I will likely choose a different hotel.

We just stayed in the Maxwell Hotel with two rooms for one night in advance of an Alaska cruise. The property itself is beautiful and very well done. The outside of the building is sorta ho-hum but wait until you step inside! The underground garage parking is secure, convenient and free. Yes, free. You don't get that very often with downtown Seattle hotels. The rooms are well designed and immaculately maintained. The room coffee maker is a higher end tassimo machine and also included are a microwave with microwavable popcorn. The bathroom products are Tommy Bahama and their scents took me right to the Caribbean. The beds were super comfortable with high thread count sheets and perfect pillows. And, while this is indeed a downtown hotel, we heard nary a peep from the streets below. It seems like it has been well soundproofed. The location is great for Seattle touring and we spent most of our free time between the lovely Seattle waterfront and the adjacent Seattle Centre (site of the 1962 World's Fair). At 3pm the hotel puts out Starbucks coffee and these amazing pineapple cupcakes --- they were so good! We came back at about 10:30 at night and mentioned that a couple of those cupcakes would really be a bedtime treat and the desk staff disappeared and then returned with a few for us. That really is testament to the quality of their service. The great people in this place are what makes the place great. They work hard to ensure that everyone has a great stay, which we certainly did. We will be back!
reviews.title: The "people make the place"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights before going on a Alaska cruise. We found the hotel very, very nice with staff eager to help us. About 3 blocks from Space Needle and a hard hike to Kerrie Park (a must see in Seattle). The Maxwell is a short walk from some nice local places to eat and drink and about 5 blocks to the Light Rail. The Link as its called will take you right to Pikes Market and all the center city places to see. We traveled Link to bus to under ground rail to get to air port. If your carring Luggage it may be to much. A cab from Maxwell to Airport is about $40 total.. The Maxwell has wonderful coffee in rooms an free cupcakes each night. The Pizza place (The Rock) at the hotel can not be beat. Best Pizza I have ever had. I would say our stay at the Maxwell Rocked.... LOL
reviews.title: Next to Space Needle an Light Rail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had high expectations going into this hotel because of the tripadvisor rating. It was a good stay. The rooms are nice and the guests are friendly. The Parkade is Tiny and tough to get in and out of but parking was Free. They have internet available and a free computer to use in the Basement which was very Handy. I never ate at the restaurant but I have heard good things from others about it. No Hot tub which was kind of a disappointment but there is a pool. The staff was all very friendly they helped us out and called a cab when we needed one and were great all around. I would recommend this hotel. Its not walking distance to the downtown core but its a 15$ Cab. There are quite a few things to do around the hotel as well. It isn't too far from the Space Needle and that whole thing. It was great value when we went as well.
reviews.title: Good Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, quiet room with many amenities that we really appreciated. We had a view of the Space Needle from our room. We are walkers so we appreciated the short walk to the Space Needle and the walking proximity of many great restaurants. Very clean, friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: Perfect for Us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eco friendly hotel with hardwood floors which seemed great until guest above us stomped around in the middle of the night, giving me a new appreciation for carpeting in hotel rooms. Otherwise a lovely hotel. Free parking and complimentary shuttle service to major tourist areas. Fun pizza place with bar in the lobby. Clean room and comfy bed. Five minute walk to Space Needle.
reviews.title: Ask for a room on the top floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Maxwell Hotel in Seattle is beautiful. We stayed at the end of September 2011. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. The room was lovely, clean, spacious, and the complementary coffee was just the right thing to start the morning off.
reviews.title: Will Definitely Go Back

reviews.text: We found the Maxwell Hotel on a travel website and chose it because we were getting a good deal, and they offered free parking!! The free parking was actually the decision maker for us when other hotels in the same price range were charging $25/day or more.
reviews.title: Will Definitely stay again!

reviews.text: The hotel was a 7-10 minute walk to the Experience Music Project, the Science Centre, the Space Needle, and The Monorail which will take you downtown for only a few dollars. Be sure to check out Pike Place Market if you've never been.
reviews.title: Great hotel, especially for the price, but not particularly *trendy*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint was that there is no restaurant in the hotel... but the rooms come with a mini-fridge and there are a few places in the area to eat at as well as a grocery store a block or so away. The Melting Pot fondue restaurant is only a few blocks away and nice to try for something different.
reviews.title: Don't Spread the GOOD word about the Maxwell

reviews.text: Our overall experience at the Maxwell was lovely... we will definitively be going back!
reviews.title: Roomy comfortable rooms with good location

reviews.text: I stayed here in November for a business trip. It was all that and more. The room was really nice. Very modern and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is great for nice relaxing walks to the Space Needle as well as the Public Market Center. Why can't all hotels be this nice?
reviews.title: love it!

reviews.text: I stayed here over New Years with my husband and five year old daughter. We had a great time at the Maxwell. It was very easy to get to and has a convenient location near the Space Needle. The room itself was very stylish and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom only had a shower, but it was a nice shower and did not bother me.
reviews.title: Nifty hotel and a great value to boot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all enjoyed the in room Keurig coffee maker and daily water and popcorn. The refrigerator was also nice (there are two nice markets within walking distance). There is a small fitness room and a small indoor pool. My daughter loved the pool and it was a nice addition. Every afternoon there was coffee and mini pineapple cupcakes in the lobby. They were a nice treat to come back to.
reviews.title: Spacious and well-located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downsides that we noticed was that the parking lot is small and it is sometimes hard to get a spot in the late evening. There is plentiful street parking in the neighborhood and we always managed to get a spot on the hotel property. There was also not great padding between our room and the floor above. The people upstairs were loud and woke me up at 1 to 2 in the morning moving around alot. We did not have any problems with floor noise or noise from the people on the sides of us.
reviews.title: Great Spot

reviews.text: Overall it was a great little hotel. My daughter is already asking when we are going to to go back to the Pineapple Hotel again.
reviews.title: A great one night stay

reviews.text: The hotel was in the Queen Anne neighbourhood and we loved that it was a little removed from the touristy hubs but close enough to the Space Needle area for nice lovely walks to there. Great amenities in the neighbourhood. Loved the 24 hr metropolitan market and pharmacy a few blocks away. Not to mention the lovely restaurants around. The hotel was comfy and chic. Great value for money considering the shuttle service they provide. The staff looked startled when we enter and I have to say on first sight they are not what you would call friendly but they were efficient and helpful. Perhaps it's just a bit of shyness. On the whole we really enjoyed our stay. The gym was more than adequate.
reviews.title: The best thing about Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my third time staying at the Maxwell. (so I guess I like it). The facility is fantastic. It has a boutique feel, and is very quiet and comfortable. The staff are professional and friendly, even under stress. There were issues with the electronic key system and with parking the night we arrived. Despite the rudeness and impatience of some guests, the front desk staff remained calm and handled the situation well.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Unsure about the new, loud restaurant off the lobby, but it seems to have patrons most of the time. Would also recommend trying Asian Breeze down the street from the hotel, it is a beautiful setting with great food and they will make food to order (vegan, vegetarian, etc.)
reviews.title: Great choice for Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Maxwell is a good deal in Seattle. Free parking and wifi. A short brisk walk (20 min) will take you most central destinations.
reviews.title: Good value near Queen Anne

reviews.text: Only downside is that the wifi does not seem to function very well. In our room on the fourth floor it only worked if we stood and leaned on the door to the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Seattle

description: The Maxwell Hotel features stunning design and decor, blending fun, artful elements with traditional elegance. Our commitment to service and guest satisfaction begins at check-in; a gorgeous inlaid tile pineapple, the symbol of True Hospitality, is at your feet before the front desk; a reminder that you are our honored guest. The experienced staff in this downtown Seattle hotel delivers genuine,heartfelt service. Reserve online.
